alert.note: Alert for Concordia (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 11 at 7:43PM CST until March 25 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi...Louisiana... Mississippi River At Natchez affecting Wilkinson, Concordia and Adams Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY, MARCH 25... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Natchez. * WHEN...Until Friday, March 25. * IMPACTS...At 48.0 feet, Carthage Point Road becomes impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Friday the stage was 48.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 48.7 feet and then begin rising early tomorrow afternoon. It will then rise again to 48.8 feet tomorrow evening. It will fall to 48.7 feet and then begin rising early Sunday morning. It will then rise again to 49.0 feet Saturday, March 19. It will fall below flood stage Friday, March 25. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Mississippi River Natchez 48.0 48.6 Fri 7 pm CST 48.8 48.8 48.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 48 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1000 AM CST.
